*The 1953 International Chorus Contest is distinguished from all those after it because it was by invitation of the choruses' District Presidents and not necessarily in District Competitions so the Grand Rapids [[Great Lakes Chorus]] was awarded the title 1953 International 'Convention' Championship Chorus, with the "convention" annotation to separate that contest from future contests. The trophy, and the title "International Chorus Champions" were awarded for the first time in 1954. More information [[BHS Intl Chorus Contest 1953 | here]].

== About == *Choruses in the [[Cardinal District]] may compete in the spring District Competition, the fall International Qualifier, or both. This page covers the fall District contest. The fall international preliminary contest winner is also the district champion.
*At contest time, the chorus and each singer must be members in good standing of both BHS and the District.

revision.comment: /* District Collegiate Quartet Champions */ fixed formatting
revision.text:
== About == In the [[Cardinal District]], there is no awarding of the official "District Collegiate Champion," but there is a competition each spring for the right to represent the district at the International Collegiate Quartet Competition.
At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator.
A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).
Heritage Station, who represented the Cardinal District, won the International Competition in 1993, before each district had a representative. In recent years, only one Cardinal District quartet has earned a top 5 medal in the International Competition: The Goods earned 5th place medals in 2007 in Denver.

== About == Novice Quartet Contests are usually held as part of the District Quartet Contest. A competing Quartet qualifies as Novice if no more than two members have ever competed in a registered quartet at a district level, in any district, prior to the contest in question. The top-scoring Novice quartet usually recieves an award.

== About == *Quartets in the [[Cardinal District]] may compete in the fall District Competition, the spring International Qualifier, or both. This page covers the fall District contest.
*This table, and the title "[[District Champions]]", refer to the "open" competition/category. At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Cardinal District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.

== About == The District Seniors Quartet Contest is held in the spring, and is distinct from the International Qualifier in the fall.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Cardinal District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers each at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.

== About == *In the [[Central States District]], the fall chorus contest determines both [[District Champions]] and International Qualifiers. The spring chorus contest is specifically for small chapters. ("Plateau A")
*At contest time, the chapter/chorus and each singer must be members in good standing of both BHS and the District.

== About == Collegiate Quartets are competing in/for the Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest.
At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator.
A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).
Not every District holds a separate Collegiate Contest; the International Qualifier is often the only Collegiate competition at the District level. "District Collegiate Champion" may not be officially awarded, but some quartet will always be the top scorer.

== About == The District Seniors Quartet Contest is held in the spring, and is distinct from the International Qualifier in the fall.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Central States District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.

== About == The District Seniors Quartet Contest is held in the spring, and is distinct from the International Qualifier in the fall.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Dixie District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.

== About == *Choruses in the [[Evergreen District]] first compete in the spring Division contests, which determine both Division Champions and District qualifiers. The fall District contest then determines both [[District Champions]] and International qualifiers.
*At contest time, the chorus and each singer must be members in good standing of both BHS and the District.
*The Evergreen District held its first District Chorus Contest in 1953.

== About == Collegiate Quartets are competing in/for the Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest.
At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator.
A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).
Not every District holds a separate Collegiate Contest; the International Qualifier is often the only Collegiate competition at the District level. "District Collegiate Champion" may not be officially awarded, but some quartet will always be the top scorer.

== About == Novice Quartet Contests are usually held as part of the District Quartet Contest. A competing Quartet qualifies as Novice if no more than two members have ever competed in a registered quartet at a district level, in any district, prior to the contest in question. The top-scoring Novice quartet usually recieves an award.

== About == *The [[Evergreen District]]'s spring Division conventions serve as both Division quartet contests and District qualifiers. Quartets placing well in the spring Division contests qualify to compete in the District contest at the fall convention.
*Each spring, one Division convention is chosen to also conduct the International qualifier quartet contest.
*This table, and the title "[[District Champions]]", refer to the "open" competition/category. At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Evergreen District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.

== About == *Choruses in the [[Far Western District]] first compete in the spring Division contests, which determine both Division Champions and District qualifiers. The fall District contest then determines both [[District Champions]] and International qualifiers.
*At contest time, the chorus and each singer must be members in good standing of both BHS and the District.
*The Far Western District held its first District Chorus Contest in 1952.

== About == Collegiate Quartets are competing in/for the Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest. At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator. A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).
Not every District holds a separate Collegiate Contest; the International Qualifier is often the only Collegiate competition at the District level. "District Collegiate Champion" may not be officially awarded, but some quartet will always be the top scorer.

== About == Novice Quartet Contests are usually held as part of the District Quartet Contest. A competing Quartet qualifies as Novice if no more than two members have ever competed in a registered quartet at a district level, in any district, prior to the contest in question. The top-scoring Novice quartet usually recieves an award.

== About == *The [[Far Western District]]'s spring Division conventions serve as both Division quartet contests and District qualifiers. Quartets placing well in the spring Division contests qualify to compete in the District contest at the fall convention.
*FWD quartets qualify for International at the spring District convention.
*This table, and the title "[[District Champions]]", refer to the "open" competition/category. At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Far Western District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.

== About == The District Seniors Quartet Contest usually takes place in the fall, and is often combined with the International Qualifier.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Far Western District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.

== About == Collegiate Quartets are competing in/for the Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest. At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator. A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).
Not every District holds a separate Collegiate Contest; the International Qualifier is often the only Collegiate competition at the District level. "District Collegiate Champion" may not be officially awarded, but some quartet will always be the top scorer.

== About == Novice Quartet Contests are usually held as part of the District Quartet Contest. A competing Quartet qualifies as Novice if no more than two members have ever competed in a registered quartet at a district level, in any district, prior to the contest in question. The top-scoring Novice quartet usually recieves an award.

== About == *Quartets in the [[Illinois District]] may compete in the fall District Competition, the spring International Qualifier, or both. This page covers the fall District contest.

== About == The [[Illinois District]] Seniors Quartet Contest takes place in the spring, separate from the fall International Qualifier.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the District, and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.
== District Seniors Quartet Champions == {| class ="wikitable" border="1" ! The other quartets listed were the top finishers in the International Qualifying Contest.

== About == *Choruses in the [[Johnny Appleseed District]] may compete in either the spring District Competition, the fall International Qualifier, or both. This page covers the spring District chorus contest.
*At contest time, the chapter/chorus and each singer must be members in good standing of both BHS and the District.

== About == Collegiate Quartets are competing in/for the Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest. At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator. A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).
Not every District holds a separate Collegiate Contest; the International Qualifier is often the only Collegiate competition at the District level. "District Collegiate Champion" may not be officially awarded, but some quartet will always be the top scorer.

== About == Novice Quartet Contests are usually held as part of the District Quartet Contest. A competing Quartet qualifies as Novice if no more than two members have ever competed in a registered quartet at a district level, in any district, prior to the contest in question. The top-scoring Novice quartet usually recieves an award.

[[Image:JADAQC.jpg|right|240px|]] == About == *Quartets in the [[Johnny Appleseed District]] may compete in the fall District Competition, the spring International Qualifier, or both. This page covers the fall District contest.
*This table, and the title "[[District Champions]]", refer to the "open" competition/category. At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Johnny Appleseed District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.

== About == The District Seniors Quartet Contest usually takes place in the fall, and is often combined with the International Qualifier.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Johnny Appleseed District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.

==See Also==
*[[LABBS Quartet Champions]] *[[LABBS Chorus Champions]] *[[Ladies Association of British Barbershop Singers]] *[[Quartet Champion competition]]
[[Category:LABBS]] [[Category:List of Champions]]

LABBS have a novice chorus award / highest placed chorus with the highest percentage of new members, which is awarded each year at their annual convention.
The original trophy was donated by Reading Ladies Barbershop Singers to the Novice Chorus with the highest marks with a later criterion added that at least 75% of the chorus must be competing for the first time in a LABBS contest. The trophy has now been replaced by a trophy donated by Oxford (previously Wantage) Barbershop Harmony Club, the last winners of the Reading Barberettes Trophy.
From 2014 the trophy is awarded to the chorus with highest percentage of new LABBS members who are competing for the first time in any convention run by a barbershop organisation. It is calculated by adding the simple percentage of new members on stage (e.g. a chorus of 30 which includes 6 new members has 20% new members) to the inverse number of the rank achieved. The highest score wins and in the event of a tie, the trophy is awarded to the chorus with the highest percentage of new members.

LABBS have a small chorus award called the Phoenix trophy which is awarded each year at their annual convention.
It was donated by Potton Barbershop Harmony Club and is awarded to the highest placed “small” chorus with up to 25 members on stage (including MD(s)). The maximum number of members may be reviewed from time to time.

== About == *Choruses in the [[Land O' Lakes District]] first compete in the fall Division contests, which determine both Division Champions and District qualifiers. The spring District contest then determines both [[District Champions]] and International qualifiers.
*At contest time, the chorus and each singer must be members in good standing of both BHS and the District.
*Starting at the first LOL chorus contest in 1946, contestants were divided into "Class A" or "Class B" according to the number of chapter members. In 1974, the District began awarding the titles of "District Chorus Champion" and "Small Chapter Chorus Champion". In 1989, the District moved to a Plateau system, also based on chapter membership.
*For years when there was no overall "District Champion", this table lists the winner of the largest-chapter category.

== About == Collegiate Quartets are competing in/for the Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest. At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator. A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).
Not every District holds a separate Collegiate Contest; the International Qualifier is often the only Collegiate competition at the District level. "District Collegiate Champion" may not be officially awarded, but some quartet will always be the top scorer.

== About == Novice Quartet Contests are usually held as part of the District Quartet Contest. A competing Quartet qualifies as Novice if no more than two members have ever competed in a registered quartet at a district level, in any district, prior to the contest in question. The top-scoring Novice quartet usually recieves an award.

== About == *The [[Land O' Lakes District]]'s spring Division conventions serve as both Division quartet contests and District qualifiers. Quartets placing well in the spring Division contests qualify to compete in the District contest at the fall convention.
*Each year, one Division convention is chosen to also conduct the International qualifier quartet contest.
*This table, and the title "[[District Champions]]", refer to the "open" competition/category. At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Land O' Lakes District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.

== About == The District Seniors Quartet Contest usually takes place in the fall, and is often combined with the International Qualifier.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Land O' Lakes District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.

== About == *Choruses in the [[Mid-Atlantic District]] first compete in the spring Division contests, which determine both Division Champions and District qualifiers. The fall District contest then determines both [[District Champions]] and International qualifiers.
*At contest time, the chorus and each singer must be members in good standing of both BHS and the District.

revision.comment: /* District Collegiate Quartet Champions */ Added 2012 champs
revision.text:
== About == Collegiate Quartets are competing in/for the Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest. At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator. A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).
Not every District holds a separate Collegiate Contest; the International Qualifier is often the only Collegiate competition at the District level. "District Collegiate Champion" may not be officially awarded, but some quartet will always be the top scorer.

== About == Novice Quartet Contests are usually held as part of the District Quartet Contest. A competing Quartet qualifies as Novice if no more than two members have ever competed in a registered quartet at a district level, in any district, prior to the contest in question. The top-scoring Novice quartet usually recieves an award.

== About == *The [[Mid-Atlantic District]]'s spring Division conventions serve as both Division quartet contests and District qualifiers. Quartets placing well in the spring Division contests qualify to compete in the District contest at the fall convention.
*MAD quartets qualify for International at the spring District convention.
*This table, and the title "[[District Champions]]", refer to the "open" competition/category. At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Mid-Atlantic District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.

== About == The District Seniors Quartet Contest usually takes place in the fall, and is often combined with the International Qualifier.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Mid-Atlantic District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.

== About == *Choruses in the [[Northeastern District]] first compete in the spring Division contests, which determine both Division Champions and District qualifiers. The fall District contest then determines both [[District Champions]] and International qualifiers.
*At contest time, the chorus and each singer must be members in good standing of both BHS and the District.

== About == Historically, 'collegiate' quartets have vied for the opportunity to compete in the Barbershop Harmony Society's international-level Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest. Prior to the 2016 contest season, a group was categorized as a collegiate quartet when all four singers were within 15-25 years of age (inclusive), regardless of affiliation with an educational institution. Early in that competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members, but this restriction has since been lifted. As of the 2016 contest season, the minimum age requirement floor for a collegiate quartet has also been eliminated, allowing members younger than 15 to compete. Perhaps as a result of this change (coupled with a perceived misnomer falsely implying the necessity of affiliation with an educational institution), the contest has been rebranded as the Youth Barbershop Quartet Contest. Going forward in the wake of this change, all such quartets are more accurately referred to as youth quartets rather than as collegiate quartets.
All groups seeking to qualify for the YBQC must register their quartet name and personnel with a BHS official coordinating the international-level youth contest. Notably, this registration as a youth quartet is a separate process from a quartet's registration with the Society at large and from any registrations to participate in contest outside of the YBQC and its qualifiers—this is to preserve the independence of the YBQC from other Society contests, so that non-BHS-member quartets may also participate. With that said, a quartet's registration in a district- or division-level contest as a quartet within a youth/collegiate age bracket is not to be confused with registration for a YBQC qualifier—this is because some districts may hold separate contests that award district- or division-level youth/collegiate championships, which are distinct from the YBQC qualification process. A youth quartet's home district in the YBQC (regardless of Society membership or lack thereof) is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).<ref>Barbershop Harmony Society. "Official Rules of the Harmony Foundation Youth Barbershop Quartet Contest." PDF file. 27 March 2016. <http://www.barbershop.org/files/documents/contestandjudging/YBQC_Rules_2016.pdf>.</ref>
As the Northeastern District does not officially award a district-level youth/collegiate championship, the following table lists the highest-scoring quartets that have qualified for the international-level YBQC (formerly CBQC) each year with the NED as their home district. Notably, it is possible for a quartet within the youth/collegiate age bracket in the district to score higher than another NED youth/collegiate quartet and, if they have not registered separately as YBQC competitors, still not to be listed with the unofficial title of NED Youth/Collegiate Champion.

== About == Novice Quartet Contests are usually held as part of the District Quartet Contest. A competing Quartet qualifies as Novice if no more than two members have ever competed in a registered quartet at a district level, in any district, prior to the contest in question. The top-scoring Novice quartet usually receives an award.

== About == *The [[Northeastern District]]'s spring Division conventions serve as both Division quartet contests and District qualifiers. Quartets placing well in the spring Division contests qualify to compete in the District contest at the fall convention.
*Each year, one Division convention is chosen to also conduct the International qualifier quartet contest.
*This table, and the title "[[District Champions]]", refer to the "open" competition/category. At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Northeastern District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.

== About == The District Seniors Quartet Contest usually takes place in the fall, and is often combined with the International Qualifier.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Northeastern District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.

== About == In the [[Carolinas District]], there is no awarding of the official "District Collegiate Champion," but there is a competition each spring for the right to represent the district at the International Collegiate Quartet Competition.
At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator.
A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).

== About == *Choruses in the [[Ontario District]] may compete in the spring District Competition, the fall International Qualifier, or both. This page covers the spring District contest.
*The '''East York Chapter Trophy''' is awarded in the Ontario District Spring Chorus Contest to the top scoring district chorus that has not won it in the previous two years.
*At contest time, the chorus and each singer must be members in good standing of both BHS and the District.

== About == Collegiate Quartets are competing in/for the Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest. At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator. A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).
Not every District holds a separate Collegiate Contest; the International Qualifier is often the only Collegiate competition at the District level. "District Collegiate Champion" may not be officially awarded, but some quartet will always be the top scorer.

== About == The Woodstock Chapter Trophy is awarded to the highest scoring quartet that has registered themselves as novice (i.e. no more than two members of the quartet have previously sung in a registered quartet competing on the district stage). This trophy is awarded in both Spring and Fall Contests assuming qualifying quartets are competing.

revision.text:
== About == The District Seniors Quartet Contest usually takes place in the fall, and is often combined with the International Qualifier.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Ontario District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.

== About == *Choruses in the [[Pioneer District]] may compete in the spring District Competition, the fall International Qualifier, or both. This page covers the spring District contest.
*At contest time, the chorus and each singer must be members in good standing of both BHS and the District.
*Choruses winning the [[Pioneer District]] Championship are ineligible for the following two years.

== About == Collegiate Quartets are competing in/for the Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest. At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator. A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).
Not every District holds a separate Collegiate Contest; the International Qualifier is often the only Collegiate competition at the District level. "District Collegiate Champion" may not be officially awarded, but some quartet will always be the top scorer.

== About == Novice Quartet Contests are usually held as part of the District Quartet Contest. A competing Quartet qualifies as Novice if no more than two members have ever competed in a registered quartet at a district level, in any district, prior to the contest in question. The top-scoring Novice quartet usually receives an award.

== About == The District Seniors Quartet Contest usually takes place in the fall, and is often combined with the International Qualifier.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Pioneer District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.

[[File:QCpin.jpg|right|300px]] Since 2011, [[LABBS]] have held a quartet competition for previous Quartet Champions as part of the LABBS convention. As previous quartet winners cannot re-compete in the main competition, it was designed to encourage quartet champions to continue as a quartet and give them a new goal to work to.
Since 2013, the premise of the competition is that it is also scored on "entertainment" value as well as the standard three category scoring in Singing, Music and Presentation to emulate a "show spot" that QCs often get asked to perform. Instead of there being a two song requirement for the competition like the standard quartet competition, there is a time limit.
The winners receive a red and silver crown pin to place on their Quartet champion ribbon.
{| class="wikitable" border="1" ! Year || Quartet || Chapter(s) ! == About == In [[SAI]], the Regional Chorus Competition also serves as the International Qualifier. In addition to the Regional Champs, other high-scoring choruses may earn a [[wildcard]] slot.
At contest time, all singers must be members in good standing of both SAI and the Region, as must the chapter itself.

revision.text:
== About == The Regional Quartet Competition also serves as the International Qualifier. If the Champions decline, 2nd place may compete instead.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both SAI and the Region, and the quartet name and personnel registered with SAI.
Region 20 was dissolved after the final Region 20 competition, which was held in Omaha, Nebraska in April of 2002. The quartets in the region were remapped to [[Region 5]] and [[Region 6]].

'''Regional Champions''' can refer to any of a great many singers, depending on context. "Region" implies [[Sweet Adelines International]] and its contests. == Quartets == === Regional Quartet Champions === In [[SAI]], the Regional Quartet Competition also serves as the International Qualifier. If the Champions decline, 2nd place may compete instead.
If 2nd place earns a [[wildcard]] slot or declines, this "automatic" invitation does '''not''' trickle down to quartets placing 3rd or lower. {| cellpadding="5" border="1" | [[R01 Quartet Champions|R01]] || [[R02 Quartet Champions|R02]] || [[R03 Quartet Champions|R03]] | [[R04 Quartet Champions|R04]] || [[R05 Quartet Champions|R05]] || [[R06 Quartet Champions|R06]] | [[R07 Quartet Champions|R07]] || [[R08 Quartet Champions|R08]] || [[R09 Quartet Champions|R09]] | [[R10 Quartet Champions|R10]] || [[R11 Quartet Champions|R11]] || [[R12 Quartet Champions|R12]] |- | [[R13 Quartet Champions|R13]] || [[R14 Quartet Champions|R14]] || [[R15 Quartet Champions|R15]] | [[R16 Quartet Champions|R16]] || [[R17 Quartet Champions|R17]] || | [[R19 Quartet Champions|R19]] || [[R20 Quartet Champions|R20]] || [[R21 Quartet Champions|R21]] | [[R22 Quartet Champions|R22]] || [[R23 Quartet Champions|R23]] || [[R24 Quartet Champions|R24]] |- | [[R25 Quartet Champions|R25]] || [[R26 Quartet Champions|R26]] || | || || [[R30 Quartet Champions|R30]] | [[R31 Quartet Champions|R31]] || [[R32 Quartet Champions|R32]] || | [[R34 Quartet Champions|R34]] || [[R35 Quartet Champions|R35]] || |} == Choruses == === SAI Regional Chorus Champions === In [[SAI]], the Regional Chorus Competition also serves as the International Qualifier. All Regional Champs are invited, and other high-scoring choruses may earn a [[wildcard]] slot. At contest time, all singers must be members in good standing of both SAI and the Region, as must the chapter itself. {| cellpadding="5" border="1" | [[R01 Chorus Champions|R01]] || [[R02 Chorus Champions|R02]] || [[R03 Chorus Champions|R03]] | [[R04 Chorus Champions|R04]] || [[R05 Chorus Champions|R05]] || [[R06 Chorus Champions|R06]] | [[R07 Chorus Champions|R07]] || [[R08 Chorus Champions|R08]] || [[R09 Chorus Champions|R09]] | [[R10 Chorus Champions|R10]] || [[R11 Chorus Champions|R11]] || [[R12 Chorus Champions|R12]] |- | [[R13 Chorus Champions|R13]] || [[R14 Chorus Champions|R14]] || [[R15 Chorus Champions|R15]] | [[R16 Chorus Champions|R16]] || [[R17 Chorus Champions|R17]] || | [[R19 Chorus Champions|R19]] || || [[R21 Chorus Champions|R21]] | [[R22 Chorus Champions|R22]] || [[R23 Chorus Champions|R23]] || [[R24 Chorus Champions|R24]] |- | [[R25 Chorus Champions|R25]] || [[R26 Chorus Champions|R26]] || | || || [[R30 Chorus Champions|R30]] | [[R31 Chorus Champions|R31]] || [[R32 Chorus Champions|R32]] || | [[R34 Chorus Champions|R34]] || [[R35 Chorus Champions|R35]] || |} == See Also == *[[Area Champions]] *[[District Champions]] *[[International Champions]] == External Links == *SAI website: [http://www.sweetadelineintl.org/competition-main.cfm competition rules and forms] [[Category:SAI]] [[Category:List of Champions]]

== About == *In the [[Rocky Mountain District]], the fall chorus contest determines both [[District Champions]] and International Qualifiers. The spring chorus contest is specifically for small choruses and [[Very Large Quartets]].
*At contest time, the chorus and each singer must be members in good standing of both BHS and the District.

== About == Collegiate Quartets are competing in/for the Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest. At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator. A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).
Not every District holds a separate Collegiate Contest; the International Qualifier is often the only Collegiate competition at the District level. "District Collegiate Champion" may not be officially awarded, but some quartet will always be the top scorer.

== About == Novice Quartet Contests are usually held as part of the District Quartet Contest. A competing Quartet qualifies as Novice if no more than two members have ever competed in a registered quartet at a district level, in any district, prior to the contest in question. The top-scoring Novice quartet usually recieves an award.

revision.comment: /* District Seniors Quartet Champions */ added a few prior champs
revision.text:
== About == The District Seniors Quartet Contest usually takes place in the fall, and is often combined with the International Qualifier.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Rocky Mountain District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.
== District Seniors Quartet Champions == {| class ="wikitable" border="1" ! Year || Quartet || From || Tenor, Lead, Bari, Bass |- | 2013 || Sugar House* || '''' | |- | 2012 || || '''' | |- | 2011 || || '''' | |- | 2010 || Four Keeps* || '''' | |- | 2009 || Four Keeps* || '''' | |- | 2008 || Steppin' Out* || '''' | |- | 2007 || Chordial Celebration || '''' | |- | 2006 || Category 4 || '''' | |- | 2005 || Sterling Silver || '''' | |- | 2004 || Senior Class Reunion* || '''' | |- | 2003 || Jukebox Swing || '''' | |- | 2002 || Kowalski Twins || '''' | |- | 2001 || Achy Breaky Parts || '''' | |- | 2000 || Voice of Experience || '''' | |- | 1999 || Legend || '''' | |- | 1998 || Brass Rail || '''' | |- | 1997 || Generation Saps || '''' | |- | 1996 || The Bamberger Express || '''' | |- | 1995 || The Bamberger Express || '''' | |- | 1994 || || '''' | |- | 1993 || 24 Karat Ring || '''' | |}
*Title not awarded in 2004, 2008, 2009, 2010, or 2013. For those years, the listed quartet is the top qualifier for International Seniors Contest.

== About ==
The "Rising Star" competition, was introduced in 1999 for quartets whose members are under-25 years old. It was also held as part of convention from 2009 until 2012 but due to scheduling and cost constraints is now held independently again.
Quartets are rated based on Sound, Music, Expression, and Showmanship.

== About == *Choruses in the [[Seneca Land District]] may compete in the spring District Competition, the fall International Qualifier, or both. This page covers the spring District contest.
*At contest time, the chorus and each singer must be members in good standing of both BHS and the District.

revision.comment: /* District Collegiate Quartet Champions */ Dug up a few more
revision.text:
== About == Collegiate Quartets are competing in/for the Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest. At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator. A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).
Not every District holds a separate Collegiate Contest; the International Qualifier is often the only Collegiate competition at the District level. "District Collegiate Champion" may not be officially awarded, but some quartet will always be the top scorer.

== About == Novice Quartet Contests are usually held as part of the District Quartet Contest. A competing Quartet qualifies as Novice if no more than two members have ever competed in a registered quartet at a district level, in any district, prior to the contest in question. The top-scoring Novice quartet usually recieves an award.

== About == *Quartets in the [[Seneca Land District]] may compete in the fall District Competition, the spring International Qualifier, or both. This page covers the fall District contest.
*This table, and the title "[[District Champions]]", refer to the "open" competition/category. At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Seneca Land District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.

== About == The District Seniors Quartet Contest usually takes place in the fall, and is often combined with the International Qualifier.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Seneca Land District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.

== About == *Choruses in the [[Sunshine District]] may compete in the spring District Competition, the fall International Qualifier, or both. This page covers the spring District contest.
*At contest time, the chorus and each singer must be members in good standing of both BHS and the District.
*Sunshine District Chorus Champions are ineligible for the following two years.

== About == Collegiate Quartets are competing in/for the Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest. At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator. A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).
Not every District holds a separate Collegiate Contest; the International Qualifier is often the only Collegiate competition at the District level. "District Collegiate Champion" may not be officially awarded, but some quartet will always be the top scorer.
In the [[Sunshine District]] specifically, District Collegiate Champions are thereafter ineligible for the District Championship, but may continue to qualify for the International Collegiate contest.

== About == *Quartets in the [[Sunshine District]] may compete in the fall District Competition, the spring International Qualifier, or both. This page covers the fall District contest.
*This table, and the title "[[District Champions]]", refer to the "open" competition/category. At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Sunshine District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.

== About == The District Seniors Quartet Contest usually takes place in the fall, and is often combined with the International Qualifier.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Sunshine District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.

== About == *Choruses in the [[Southwestern District]] first compete in the spring Division contests, which determine both Division Champions and District qualifiers. The fall District contest then determines both [[District Champions]] and International qualifiers.
*At contest time, the chorus and each singer must be members in good standing of both BHS and the District.

revision.comment: /* District Collegiate Quartet Champions */ Added TLBB
revision.text:
== About == Collegiate Quartets are competing in/for the Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest. At contest time, all four singers must be 15-25 years of age. Early in the competition's history, quartets could have no more than two BHS members; this restriction has since been lifted. The quartet name and personnel must be registered with BHS's Collegiate Coordinator. A Collegiate Quartet's "home" district is determined by the location of its singers' educational institution(s) and/or permanent residence(s).
Not every District holds a separate Collegiate Contest; the International Qualifier is often the only Collegiate competition at the District level. "District Collegiate Champion" may not be officially awarded, but some quartet will always be the top scorer.

== About == Novice Quartet Contests are usually held as part of the District Quartet Contest. A competing Quartet qualifies as Novice if no more than two members have ever competed in a registered quartet at a district level, in any district, prior to the contest in question. The top-scoring Novice quartet usually recieves an award.

== About == *The [[Southwestern District]]'s spring Division conventions serve as both Division quartet contests and District qualifiers. Quartets placing well in the spring Division contests qualify to compete in the District contest at the fall convention.
*Each year, one Division convention is chosen to also conduct the International qualifier quartet contest.
*This table, and the title "[[District Champions]]", refer to the "open" competition/category. At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Southwestern District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.

[[Category:Southwestern District]] [[Category:List of Champions]]

== About == The District Seniors Quartet Contest usually takes place in the fall, and is often combined with the International Qualifier.
At contest time, all four singers must be members in good standing of both the [[Barbershop Harmony Society]] and the [[Southwestern District]], and the quartet name and personnel registered with the Society.
In addition, quartets in the Seniors category must consist of four singers at least 55 years old, with a combined total of at least 240 years of age.

[[Category:Southwestern District]] [[Category:List of Champions]]

Since 2012, [[LABBS]] and [[BABS]] have held a mixed quartet competition as part of the LABBS convention. In 2015 it was announced that the 2015 competition would be run by Barbershop in Harmony ([[BinH]]) which would allow [[Sweet Adelines International]] R31 members to compete without having to join [[LABBS]] as Club at Large.
Contrary to [[LABBS]] and [[BABS]] rules for their regular quartet competitions, Mixed quartet Champions are allowed to re-compete.
